channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Bill Nelson backs NASA decision on lunar lander in confirmation hearing
item.description: The hearing was bland, but Nelson’s backing of the bidding process was significant.

item.title: PS4 owners lament the shutdown of beloved “Communities” social network
item.description: Built-in message boards were a way to find and connect with like-minded players.

item.title: Samsung starts official smartphone upcycling program
item.description: Users can now try the “beta” program to repurpose old devices.

item.title: 2021’s World Car of the Year goes to the electric Volkswagen ID.4
item.description: Plus, the adorable Honda E wins World Urban Car.

item.title: Sony takes aim at Xbox Game Pass with PlayStation Plus Video Pass
item.description: Scant details suggest Sony-published movies with your Sony-published games.

item.title: Brace yourselves. Facebook has a new mega-leak on its hands
item.description: Facebook Email Search v1.0 can process 5 million email addresses per day, researcher says.

item.title: Pause of J&J vaccine was the right call, say 88% of polled Americans
item.description: Poll results contradict concerns that the pause added to hesitancy.

item.title: Everybody hates “FLoC,” Google’s tracking plan for Chrome ads
item.description: The EFF, Mozilla, Brave, Vivaldi, and DuckDuckGo say “no way” to FLoC.

item.title: Grab a pair of recommended Anker noise-canceling headphones for $64
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on Fitbit trackers, great wireless mice, and more.

item.title: Hackers are exploiting a Pulse Secure 0-day to breach orgs around the world
item.description: Exploits allow state-backed hackers to bypass 2FA and breach defense contractors.

item.title: In evolving to infect mink, SARS-CoV-2’s risk for humans changes
item.description: It’s less infective, but it has a lower immune profile.

item.title: EU lawmakers propose strict curbs on use of facial recognition
item.description: Draft legislation would limit use to essential public-interest scenarios.

item.title: Apple announces new M1-based iMac in 7 fancy colors
item.description: Apple’s new all-in-one desktops have a completely different look.

item.title: Venmo’s new crypto service lets you buy and sell bitcoin, ether, and litecoin
item.description: PayPal subsidiary Venmo rolls crypto platform out to users starting today.

item.title: iPad Pro gets M1 chip, “Liquid Retina” mini-LED screen
item.description: iPad Pros get Apple’s best SoC, with a mini-LED display for the 12.9-inch version.

item.title: Apple updates the Apple TV 4K with the A12 processor, new remote
item.description: The A12 Bionic chip will make games run faster and enhances video as well.

item.title: Apple takes on Tile with AR-ready AirTags tracking devices
item.description: The Find My app and the iPhone’s U1 chip finally make a lot more sense.

item.title: Liveblog—All the news from Apple’s “Spring Loaded” event
item.description: Get your updates about new iPads and more here, starting at 10am Pacific!

item.title: How “cosmetic” DLC became “pay to win” camouflage in some online shooters
item.description: COD: Warzone and Fortnite struggle to balance player style and gameplay visibility.

item.title: Minivans are better at daily life than SUVs, and it’s time for a comeback
item.description: They have a commanding view, three rows of seats, and even handle OK, too.

item.title: Elon Musk denies Autopilot was active before deadly crash in Texas
item.description: “Data logs recovered so far show Autopilot was not enabled,” Musk tweeted.

item.title: Coal miners’ union lobbies for jobs in renewable energy
item.description: “We’ll take good paying jobs any way we can get them.”

item.title: HTC’s wireless Vive Air headset outed by a premature award
item.description: All-in-one VR headset resembles a pair of running shoes. That could be good HTC news.

item.title: Google Play apps steal texts and pepper you with unauthorized purchases
item.description: Google removes eight apps after receiving report from researchers.

item.title: Microsoft Visual Studio 2022 will (finally) enter the 64-bit world
item.description: Next year’s upgrade—out for preview later this summer—looks like a doozy.

item.title: Marvel drops first teaser for Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings
item.description: Simu Liu stars as a gifted martial artist seeking to escape his dark family history.

item.title: More J&J troubles: Vaccine manufacturing halted and more possible clot cases
item.description: CDC advisory committee will meet Friday to decide the fate of the troubled vaccine.

item.title: Parler re-platformed as Apple allows social network back into App Store
item.description: “Free speech” social media network reportedly revamped its moderation approach.

item.title: Millions of web surfers are being targeted by a single malvertising group
item.description: Tag Barnakle is using infected ad servers to go “straight for the jugular,” firm says.

item.title: Sony reverses course, keeps legacy PlayStation online stores open
item.description: PS3 and Vita stores will remain available, but PSP will sunset as planned.

item.title: Missing Arctic ice fueled the “Beast of the East” winter storm
item.description: Less ice means more moisture in the air, but connecting it to weather is difficult.

item.title: Cops “almost 99.9% sure” Tesla had no one at the wheel before deadly crash
item.description: Car was reportedly traveling at a “high rate of speed” in a residential area.

item.title: Denisovans may have met us in the Pacific
item.description: Different island populations also intermingled in complex ways.

item.title: Dishy McFlatface to become “fully mobile,” allowing Starlink use away from home
item.description: Musk: Starlink customers will be able to use their dishes “anywhere” by year-end.

item.title: Fitbit announces new style-focused Luxe smartband
item.description: The fitness company has teamed up with another fashion brand for a jewelry-styled special edition.

item.title: “Chrome Memories”—an early look at Google’s UI update to History
item.description: The new view is hidden behind a feature flag that defaults to “off” for now.

item.title: Years after Google and Apple, Samsung finally gets eSIM working in the US
item.description: If you have the Note 20 and T-Mobile, you can finally ditch your plastic SIM card.

item.title: Amazon’s first Internet satellites will not launch on Blue Origin rockets
item.description: “ULA is a fantastic partner that’s successfully launched dozens of missions.”

item.title: Cracking the case: New study sheds more light on the “Brazil nut effect”
item.description: Shape and orientation of a given Brazil nut is the key to its upward movement.

item.title: Nintendo sues Bowser (not that one) over Team Xecuter’s Switch hacks
item.description: Civil suit seeks monetary damages following Bowser’s October arrest.

item.title: NASA has flown a helicopter on Mars, and it went brilliantly [Updated]
item.description: This is all experimental, but Ingenuity pulled it off.

item.title: Who will win the self-driving race? Here are eight possibilities
item.description: The state of the self-driving industry, from Argo to Zoox.

item.title: This electric fastback is the next Audi A6 e-tron, due in late 2022
item.description: It’s the first car to use the new Premium Platform Electric architecture.

item.title: The humble shrub that’s predicting a terrible fire season
item.description: Chamise is kind of a crystal ball for understanding how badly California might burn.

item.title: Novel hydrogels can safely remove graffiti from vandalized street art
item.description: Italian chemists successfully tested their hydrogels on actual street art in Florence.

item.title: At 38.5% vaccinated, US may be running low on people eager for a shot
item.description: Some worry the country can’t keep up the current pace of vaccination.

item.title: DC’s Rorschach: A detective walks into a world shaped by squids and superheroes
item.description: During COVID-19, Rorschach has been something to look forward to each month.

item.title: NASA selects SpaceX as its sole provider for a lunar lander
item.description: “We looked at what’s the best value to the government.”

item.title: 21.5-inch iMac supply dwindles amid chip shortages, possible refresh
item.description: A new iMac landing next week is a real possibility.

item.title: Backdoored developer tool that stole credentials escaped notice for 3 months
item.description: AWS credentials and private repository tokens could allow self-perpetuating attacks.

item.title: Arkansas House passes unconstitutional bill putting creationism in schools
item.description: Despite unanimous Democratic opposition, the bill moves on to the Senate.

item.title: Dogecoin has risen 400 percent in the last week because why not
item.description: Dogecoin rallied after Elon Musk tweeted a photo of “Doge Barking at the Moon.”

item.title: Today’s best deals: Board games we like, indoor security cameras, and more
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on LG monitors, Amazon devices, and PC games.
